wikipedia_page.main: John Elliott (12 October 1901 – 3 July 1945) was a British middleweight boxer who competed in the 1920s.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1924 Summer Olympics

response: He won the bronze medal in boxing at the 1924 Summer Olympics in the middleweight category, losing against John Elliott in the semi-final. He won the bronze medal bout against Leslie Black.

link_mentions.page: Boxing at the 1924 Summer Olympics – Middleweight
response: Two days later the French crowd were still incensed when Mallin boxed in the final against John Elliott. Brousse came in his boxing attire and his fans lifted him up into the ring. Only after intervention by the police were the two British opponents able to contest the final.
